instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> after repair show 100% battery only when charging
threads.message: the 1.85V buffering cap was shorted <CAPACITOR>C7375</CAPACITOR>, replaced, F7140 went out too, replaced, now macbook is working fine, charging, works on battery, but when i connect the charger right away shows 100% charge, and when disconnected shows the actual charge, like 84%, SMC PRAM reset, same thing, actually it is wokrking fine but that is weird, tried 2 new batteries, same

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> after repair show 100% battery only when charging
threads.message:
I'm speculating here.. until a pro turns up.

Is <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> damaged? Check to see if it's blocking properly between Drain & source, or if there's any conduction between gate and D/S

( Likewise check <RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR> - 51 - 52,  maybe <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> was damaged, though I'm not familiar enough with how macOS derives its battery charge status % )

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> after repair show 100% battery only when charging
threads.message: The usual checks done around the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>? Resistance between 17/18 27/28? PPBUS voltage without battery? <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> shorted or fried?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> after repair show 100% battery only when charging
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> after repair show 100% battery only when charging
threads.message:
no water damage, <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> is fine

replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, same
i will leave it like that

threads.message: damn i did not boot from ext hdd, its an osx issue
